LLM Content Ingest API Initiative7/27/2025

The LLM Content Ingest API is an IAB Tech Lab Initiative to help publishers and brands work with LLMs to monetize content and ensure accuracy

Read

<!DOCTYPE html>

	<title>IAB Tech Lab</title>
	<meta name="description" content="Established in 2014, the IAB Technology Laboratory (Tech Lab) is a non-profit consortium that engages a member community globally to develop foundational technology and standards that enable growth and trust in the digital media ecosystem. Comprised of digital publishers, ad technology firms, agencies, marketers, and other member companies, IAB Tech Lab focuses on solutions for brand safety and ad fraud; identity, data, and consumer privacy; ad experiences and measurement; and programmatic effectiveness. Its work includes the OpenRTB real-time bidding protocol, ads.txt anti-fraud specification, Open Measurement SDK for viewability and verification, VAST video specification, and DigiTrust identity service. Board members/companies are listed at https://iabtechlab.com/about-the-iab-tech-lab/tech-lab-leadership/. For more information, please visit https://iabtechlab.com." />

				<div class="elementor-widget-container">
					<h1 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default"><span class="ez-toc-section" id="LLM_Content_Ingest_API_Initiative"></span>LLM Content Ingest API Initiative<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h1>				</div>
				</div>
				<div class="elementor-element elementor-element-e181559 elementor-widget elementor-widget-html" data-id="e181559" data-element_type="widget" data-widget_type="html.default">
				<div class="elementor-widget-container">
					<span style="color:grey"><i class="fa fa-clock"></i> Last updated: June 4, 2025</span>				</div>
				</div>
				<div class="elementor-element elementor-element-2e0f2e4 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-id="2e0f2e4" data-element_type="widget" data-widget_type="heading.default">
				<div class="elementor-widget-container">
					<h3 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default"><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Why_this_initiative"></span>Why this initiative?<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>				</div>
				</div>
				<div class="elementor-element elementor-element-d771c7d elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-id="d771c7d" data-element_type="widget" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
				<div class="elementor-widget-container">
									<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The rapid rise of AI agents, large language models (LLMs), and AI-driven search summaries (e.g., Googles Gemini-powered AI Overviews) is transforming how users access information. AI-driven search summaries are reducing publisher traffic by 2060% (up to 90% for niche sites), with an estimated $2 billion ad revenue loss significantly impacting the economic model of the web. This shift, coupled with with 117% bot traffic surge (5.05M scrapes/site, 1.89M hidden scrapes) and 95.7% fewer referrals (0.37% vs. 8.63% Google) and the concentration of digital advertising revenue among a handful of tech giants (80.8% ad revenue is shared by the top 10 and 11.0% by the top 1125), threatens the sustainability of publishers on the open internet. Without intervention, the content ecosystem that fuels AI systems risks collapse, degrading both publisher viability and AI quality.</span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">And it is not just the publishers that will be affected. As users shift to AI generated answers to their information needs, brand reputation and messaging will only be as good as the AI system the user is using. Thus it is necessary to ensure the AI systems have the right information about the brands and they are all able to get it from the source of truth- the brand itself in an organized manner.</span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This document is an initial recommended guidance for</span></p><ul><li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Publishers and brands to control and provide guided access for LLM and AI agent bots</span></li><li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Providing LLM friendly content access</span></li><li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cost per crawl monetization opportunity</span></li><li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Query API based monetization for content with variable pricing and bidding opportunities for fast moving or in demand content</span></li><li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">AI native technologies like Model Context Protocol (MCP) based NLWeb API</span></li></ul><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Learn more about the AI challenges for the web economy, actions publishers and brands can take and draft versions of recommended methods including suggested APIs for content monetization in our LLMs and AI Agents Integration framework.</span></p>								</div>
				</div>

				const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
			</script>

readabilityObject.title: LLM Content Ingest API Initiative
readabilityObject.content:
The rapid rise of AI agents, large language models (LLMs), and AI-driven search summaries (e.g., Googles Gemini-powered AI Overviews) is transforming how users access information. AI-driven search summaries are reducing publisher traffic by 2060% (up to 90% for niche sites), with an estimated $2 billion ad revenue loss significantly impacting the economic model of the web. This shift, coupled with with 117% bot traffic surge (5.05M scrapes/site, 1.89M hidden scrapes) and 95.7% fewer referrals (0.37% vs. 8.63% Google) and the concentration of digital advertising revenue among a handful of tech giants (80.8% ad revenue is shared by the top 10 and 11.0% by the top 1125), threatens the sustainability of publishers on the open internet. Without intervention, the content ecosystem that fuels AI systems risks collapse, degrading both publisher viability and AI quality. 

And it is not just the publishers that will be affected. As users shift to AI generated answers to their information needs, brand reputation and messaging will only be as good as the AI system the user is using. Thus it is necessary to ensure the AI systems have the right information about the brands and they are all able to get it from the source of truth- the brand itself in an organized manner.

This document is an initial recommended guidance for 

  • Publishers and brands to control and provide guided access for LLM and AI agent bots
  • Providing LLM friendly content access 
  • Cost per crawl monetization opportunity
  • Query API based monetization for content with variable pricing and bidding opportunities for fast moving or in demand content
  • AI native technologies like Model Context Protocol (MCP) based NLWeb API

Learn more about the AI challenges for the web economy, actions publishers and brands can take and draft versions of recommended methods including suggested APIs for content monetization in our LLMs and AI Agents Integration framework.

metadata.title: IAB Tech Lab
metadata.description: Established in 2014, the IAB Technology Laboratory (Tech Lab) is a non-profit consortium that engages a member community globally to develop foundational technology and standards that enable growth and trust in the digital media ecosystem. Comprised of digital publishers, ad technology firms, agencies, marketers, and other member companies, IAB Tech Lab focuses on solutions for brand safety and ad fraud; identity, data, and consumer privacy; ad experiences and measurement; and programmatic effectiveness. Its work includes the OpenRTB real-time bidding protocol, ads.txt anti-fraud specification, Open Measurement SDK for viewability and verification, VAST video specification, and DigiTrust identity service. Board members/companies are listed at https://iabtechlab.com/about-the-iab-tech-lab/tech-lab-leadership/. For more information, please visit https://iabtechlab.com.
